documents.content:
# California Child Care Family Fee Schedule 2025-26

## Major Reform: Reduced Fees!

Effective July 1, 2025, California dramatically reduced family fees for subsidized child care.

## Who Pays Zero Fees?

**NO family fees if:**
- Income below 75% of State Median Income
- Receiving CalWORKs cash assistance
- Child in foster care
- Child receiving Child Protective Services
- Enrolled in CHAN (children with severe disabilities)
- Enrolled in Federal Migrant Program
- Experiencing homelessness (San Francisco County)

## Family Fee Caps

For families WITH income-based fees:
- **Maximum fee:** 1% of monthly income
- This applies from 75% SMI through the top of eligibility (85% or 100% SMI)

## Example Family Fees (2025-26)

### Family of 4 Examples
| Monthly Income | As % of SMI | Monthly Fee |
|----------------|-------------|-------------|
| $7,000 | Below 75% | $0 |
| $8,500 | ~80% SMI | ~$85 |
| $9,500 | ~90% SMI | ~$95 |
| $10,500 | ~99% SMI | ~$105 |

### Fee by Care Type
| Income Level | Part-Time Fee | Full-Time Fee |
|--------------|---------------|---------------|
| At 75% SMI | ~$60-70 | ~$120-140 |
| At 85% SMI | ~$70-80 | ~$140-170 |
| At 100% SMI | ~$120-140 | ~$240-280 |

*Exact amounts vary by family size*

## One Fee Per Family

**Important:** You pay ONE family fee regardless of:
- Number of children in care
- Number of programs enrolled in
- Number of providers used

The fee is based on the child certified for the most hours.

## Fee Exemptions (One-Time, 12 Months)

You may qualify for a 12-month fee exemption if your child:
- Is at risk of abuse, neglect, or exploitation
- Is receiving Child Protective Services

## How Fees Are Paid

- Deducted from provider payment by your APP
- Paid directly to provider in some cases
- Contact your local agency for specific process

**Source:** CDE Management Bulletin 25-06
**URL:** https://www.cde.ca.gov/sp/cd/ci/mb2506.asp
